definition: to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: So what happens in the very likely event they find more tainted products?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，如果在整治中發現了更加有害的產品呢？

sentences.english: And you know what, the waste you exhale when you smoke is more toxic to cause cancer.
sentences.chinese: 你知道嗎，你吸菸時呼出的廢氣更加具有致癌性質。

sentences.english: Their DNA was also loosening up and making memory genes more active.
sentences.chinese: 它們的DNA也鬆開了，使記憶體基因更加活躍。

sentences.english: The effect of atomizing is better and burning is more full by improving nozzle structure inside and outside.
sentences.chinese: 同時改進燒嘴結構，使霧化效果更好，燃燒更加完全。

sentences.english: Serendipitous people are more fearless about trying something new.
sentences.chinese: 偶爾人們會更加勇於嘗試新鮮事物。

sentences.english: it was actually the management training that the company provided. That was the bigger draw.
sentences.chinese: 但它提供了一個管理培訓項目的這一點更加吸引我。

sentences.english: It was also simpler for the manager.
sentences.chinese: 這對於管理者來說也更加簡單。

sentences.english: After that the struggle inside the party grew more acute.
sentences.chinese: 在那以後，黨內的鬥爭變得更加尖銳。

sentences.english: The tools of media will become more easy to use and more affordable.
sentences.chinese: 媒體工具會變得更加容易操作，更加便宜。

sentences.english: The tools of media will become more easy to use and more affordable.
sentences.chinese: 媒體工具會變得更加容易操作，更加便宜。

sentences.english: From now on, we need to be more mobile and flexible, carefully choosing battle opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 今後，我們要更加機動靈活，精細地尋求。

sentences.english: People will respect you more if you own up to your problems.
sentences.chinese: 如果你坦率承任自己的問題，人們會更加尊重你。

sentences.english: Velour provides extra softness and size.
sentences.chinese: 絲絨質地更加柔軟，尺寸也更大。

sentences.english: With the oil prices up, people would rather to use E-bike.
sentences.chinese: 隨着石油價格的上漲，人們更加願意使用電單車。

sentences.english: This Button Hook makes dressing with one hand easier and quicker.
sentences.chinese: 這使得巴頓胡克敷料用一隻手更加容易和快捷。

sentences.english: Need to make your midnite bathroom appointments more exhilarating?
sentences.chinese: 想讓你午夜的浴室之約更加愉悅嗎？

definition: to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
very/completely/utterly/extremely/absolutely/hundred percent/to divide into ten equal parts
increasingly/more and more/ever more/all the more
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
